comment.body:
\section{Purpose of This Document}
This document, \citetitle{MTCPart5} of the MTConnectÂ® Standard, defines a structured data model used to organize information required to coordinate inter-operations between pieces of equipment.
This data model is based on an \gls{interaction model} that defines the exchange of information between pieces of equipment and is organized in the MTConnect Standard as the XML element \glspl{interface component}.
\glspl{interface} is modeled as an extension to the \gls{mtconnectdevices} and \gls{mtconnectstreams} XML documents. \glspl{interface component} leverages similar rules and terminology as those used to describe a component in the \gls{mtconnectdevices} XML document. \glspl{interface component} also uses similar methods for reporting data to those used in the \gls{mtconnectstreams} XML document.
As defined in \citetitle{MTCPart2}, \glspl{interface component} is modeled as a \gls{top level} component in the \gls{mtconnectdevices} document (see \fig{interfaces-as-a-structural-element}). Each individual \gls{interface component} XML element is modeled as a \gls{lower level} component of \glspl{interface component}. The data associated with each \gls{interface} is modeled within each \gls{lower level} component.
\begin{note} Note: See \citetitle{MTCPart2} and \citetitle{MTCPart3} of the MTConnect Standard for information on how \glspl{interface} is structured in the XML documents which are returned from an \gls{Agent} in response to a \gls{probe httprequest}, \gls{sample httprequest}, or \gls{current httprequest} request.
\end{note}
\section{Terminology and Conventions} Refer to Section 2 of \citetitle{MTCPart1} for a dictionary of terms, reserved language, and document conventions used in the MTConnect Standard.
